formattedAddress: 452 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10024, USA
adrFormatAddress: 452 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10024, USA

originalText.text: I really wanted to like this place, and obviously lots of people do, because it was busy when we went on a Thursday night. However, even though the prices arenâ€™t bad, the food is just not quite right. The hot and sour soup was neither spicy nor sour, and the boiled dumplings had a puffy steamed quality, and taste wise they werenâ€™t great. The shrimp and chicken wontons with spicy sauce were okay but surprisingly lacking in flavor. You can get bags of frozen dumplings to take home for $15.

originalText.text: What a great place! We just dropped in after seeing it while we passed by. The pork/noodle soup was amazingly tasty. But note that the pork is probably pork belly, so it was pretty fatty. But the broth was tasty, the pork well seasoned, the noodles cooked just right. We also had several kinds of fried dumplings that we enjoyed. I will go here again. Very limited seating if you are dining in. Prices were reasonable

text.text: What a great place! We just dropped in after seeing it while we passed by. The pork/noodle soup was amazingly tasty. But note that the pork is probably pork belly, so it was pretty fatty. But the broth was tasty, the pork well seasoned, the noodles cooked just right. We also had several kinds of fried dumplings that we enjoyed. I will go here again. Very limited seating if you are dining in. Prices were reasonable

originalText.text:
ILY VANESSAâ€™S!

Wouldnâ€™t change a thing. I love how unassuming this place is and how they play 90s R&B throwbacks inside ðŸ˜… such a vibe. This place is super informal and casual and typically not very busy around dinner time in my experience. Four stars on atmosphere because I like that itâ€™s chill - a nice getaway from the city streets and the music is on point. By no means is it energetic and popping. It really depends on your mood and what youâ€™re looking for with this.

Must get: sesame pancake sandwich. Itâ€™s such a good value and quite filling. I have been going with the tofu and vegetable option.

I have also tried the sour and spicy cucumbers and they surprised me - was a nice side.

Kimchi side is also great! Not very fishy which I loved and the apple slices gave sweeter notes in it.

I have tried the spicy vegan beef dumplings too but I come back for the sesame pancakes.

originalText.text:
Live nearby and have come a few times - fine as a quick dumpling spot, but would hesitate to make it a full meal.

Soups -- pretty much no flavor, just cornstarch and water. Could use seasoning of all kinds (pepper, salt, literally any spice). Do not recommend.

Dumplings -- pretty good, but nothing incredible. Best recommendation is the chicken / shrimp wontons in chili oil.

originalText.text:
Cozy small joint with plenty variety of dumplings ðŸ¥Ÿ. Options to dine in, not very much space for hanging around, itâ€™s more like in and out. Take out or even buy them frozen to take it home, which I believe is very convenient.

Theyâ€™re big portions, flavorful and delicious. Itâ€™s more like an appetizer for those with a big appetite.
